last_episode_to_air.name: How To Track Your Package
last_episode_to_air.overview: After having a delivery stolen, John investigates how to keep his packages secure.

name: How To with John Wilson
overview: In a uniquely hilarious odyssey of self-discovery and cultural observation, documentary filmmaker and self-described "anxious New Yorker" John Wilson covertly and obsessively films the lives of his fellow New Yorkers while attempting to give everyday advice on relatable topics. The awkward contradictions of modern life are eased by Wilson’s candid, unpolished commentary. Building upon Wilson’s previously released "how to" short films, each episode takes wildly unexpected turns but is grounded in John's refreshing honesty.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: In season three, documentary filmmaker and self-described “anxious New Yorker” John Wilson continues his heartfelt mission of self-discovery, exploration, and observation as he films the lives of his fellow New Yorkers while attempting to give everyday advice on six new deceptively simple and wildly random topics. Building upon season two, the episodes take unexpected turns, as John navigates a new set of topics including: how to find a public restroom, how to work out, and how to clean your ears.

episodes.name: How To Make Small Talk
episodes.overview: John Wilson reflects on the delicate balancing act of making – and safely redirecting – casual conversation, highlighting the rewards and risks of small talk.

episodes.name: How To Put Up Scaffolding
episodes.overview: John Wilson offers a unique history of New York’s hideous yet sprawling network of overhead “protection,” otherwise known as scaffolding – and contemplates what it might take to reduce its nearly 300-mile eyesore presently overtaking the city.

episodes.name: How To Improve Your Memory
episodes.overview: John Wilson taps into his “Memory Palace” for an unforgettable exploration into our ability – or inability – to remember things.

episodes.name: How To Cover Your Furniture
episodes.overview: While trying to live peacefully with his furniture destroying cat, John Wilson explores the challenges of keeping an object in pristine condition.

episodes.name: How To Split the Check
episodes.overview: John Wilson attempts to make sense of the intricacies – and fairness practices – behind the complex art of splitting the check.

episodes.name: How To Cook the Perfect Risotto
episodes.overview: To thank his elderly landlord for all the times she has cooked and cleaned for him, John attempts to make her favorite dish. Season finale.

episodes.name: How To Invest in Real Estate
episodes.overview: After renting the same apartment for years, John contemplates an unexpected opportunity to become a homeowner.

episodes.name: How To Appreciate Wine
episodes.overview: When confronted by the overwhelming and mysterious world of wine, John attempts to master his senses and make informed choices.

episodes.name: How To Find a Spot
episodes.overview: John reflects on the competitive and complex process of parking in NYC, where the possibilities opened by having a car comes with a catch.

episodes.name: How To Throw Out Your Batteries
episodes.overview: Seeking a solution to the universal conundrum of battery disposal, John ponders the value of things we hold onto – and what we throw away.

episodes.name: How To Remember Your Dreams
episodes.overview: After years of rooting his life in non-fiction, John drifts from the world of rational thought in hopes of finally remembering his dreams.

episodes.name: How To Be Spontaneous
episodes.overview: Though determined to let fate be his guide, John’s attempt at spontaneity doesn’t go as planned.

episodes.name: How To Find a Public Restroom
episodes.overview: As the availability of public restrooms dwindles in NYC, John tries to find clever ways to relieve himself.

episodes.name: How To Clean Your Ears
episodes.overview: After having his ears properly cleaned, John wonders if better hearing is what he actually wants.

episodes.name: How To Work Out
episodes.overview: John starts working out and tracks the pros and cons of big.

episodes.name: How To Watch the Game
episodes.overview: John's discovery of the deeply-embedded rituals and bonding in sports leads to a greater appreciation of the game.

episodes.name: How To Watch Birds
episodes.overview: After realizing too much of his life is spent inside, John tries out birding, which opens up a world of possibility...and dubious claims.

episodes.name: How To Track Your Package
episodes.overview: After having a delivery stolen, John investigates how to keep his packages secure.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: In season three, documentary filmmaker and self-described “anxious New Yorker” John Wilson continues his heartfelt mission of self-discovery, exploration, and observation as he films the lives of his fellow New Yorkers while attempting to give everyday advice on six new deceptively simple and wildly random topics. Building upon season two, the episodes take unexpected turns, as John navigates a new set of topics including: how to find a public restroom, how to work out, and how to clean your ears.
